newsitem.title: USA: Western Resources sees holder votes on deal. [CORRECTED 21:46 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Western Resources sees holder votes on deal. [CORRECTED 21:46 GMT]

text.p: Western Resources Inc said Thursday it expects to schedule shareholder meetings in late summer or early fall regarding its proposed $2 billion acquisition of Kansas City Power and Light Co.
Shareholders of both companies are required to vote on the transaction.

At the company's annual meeting, Western chief executive officer John Hayes also said Western plans to file for the proposed transaction with state regulators in Missouri and Kansas on Friday (corrects from the U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission on Friday). The company plans to file with the U.S Federal Energy Regulatory Commission at a later time.

Western launched a hostile takeover of Kansas City Power and Light more than a year ago and eventually scuttled the utility's planned union with UtiliCorp United Inc. Western and Kansas City Power then agreed upon a friendly deal in February.
